comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: The parish church of St Andrew.  The picture is taken from Church Street and the gate on the right is no longer there.  There is a cul-de-sac called Parsons Pen through there now.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: There is still a gate - and a street. Street View

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/66311327@N05] 
The gate that's still there isn't the one I was referring to.  The gate on the right is closing off the drive that became the cul-de-sac, and you don't have a gate across a public road so that one is gone.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: I meant this gate: Street View The new iron gate looks smaller than the old wooden one, but I think the wall at Parsons Pen could be old, as shown in this map from 1886: source: www.old-maps.co.uk

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Retired at last and B-59: Thanks for the identification of this church.  We will add more information to the description when we update.

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/66311327@N05]  Yes, I'm with you now.  I'm confusing the gate on the vicarage drive for a field gate.  And I agree that the wall is old, it will have been the boundary of the church grounds, and needed to be solid to keep stock out in the old days.

If you follow Street View up to the end of Parsons Pen the footpath appears to continue but doesn't follow its old route across the fields (now the school playing fields).  It joins a new cycle path going N/S along the field boundaries.
